resources.string: Smalltalk is an app to help you keep track of the things you want to talk about with friends, family, colleagues, and even strangers. \n \nThis landing page has some tips on how to use the app. When you\'re done, press the "finished" button at the bottom. Don\'t worry, you can always view this screen again through the drop down menu at the top right of your screen.

Smalltalk helps you keep track of topics to talk about and contacts to talk about topics with. You can also use tags to help organize your topics and contacts. To add a new topic, contact, or tag, press the button at the top of your screen which looks like this:

Pick a name and, optionally, some details for each item. Topics have a special field: a URL. If you add a link in this field, you will be able to access it with a click of a button.\n\nThe page for each item shows their name, URL, details and all of the topics, contacts and tags connected with them. To see connected items, click the header that looks like this:
Of course, you won\'t have any connected items at first. To add some, press that header for a long moment, and a screen will pop up with a list of items you can connect your item to:

Tags help you add a topic to many contacts at once. To do this, create a tag and associate it with relevant contacts - for instance, a "family" tag for contacts in your family or a "sports" tag for contacts who like sports.\n\nThen, when you create a sports topic, link it to the "sports" tag instead of to individual contacts. Now, for those contacts, you can see that topic listed under their topics by selecting the option "topics via tags":

Archiving and starring help you manage your topics. When you\'re all done with a topic, you can archive it by pressing the button that looks like an eye. That topic will be hidden by default from now on. Conversely, starring a topic tells the app that the topic is important. In certain views, you\'ll be able to show only starred topics. The archive and star icons look like this:

If you\'re feeling adventurous, you can start archiving and starring topics for individual contacts or groups. For instance, you might want to hide a topic that you\'ve talked about with one person but keep it visible for everyone else. To do this, press the star or eye icon next to the related item:
Press it once to change the state, for instance from shown to archived. Then press it again, for a little bit longer, to "lock" the relationship in that state. A locked item looks like this:

"Locking" a relationship means that it will keep that state, regardless of what happens to the topic as a whole. If you lock a relationship as "shown", that topic will always show up for that contact even if you archive the topic for everyone else.
Too confusing? Don\'t worry, you can just ignore those buttons too.

A few more things! First, you can add new topics, contacts or tags by using the "share" function on your phone. Any text or URL that is shared from another app, such as your web browser, or the Twitter app, can be added - just look for the Smalltalk icon in the share menu.

You can also add contacts en masse from your phone by going to the "import contacts" option in the dropdown menu.

That's it! Have fun using Smalltalk, and please contact me if you have any questions or issues.
You can import contacts from your phone by selecting them from a list shown on the next page. To filter your contacts, select one of the options below, or choose "all".
Select contacts and groups/tags to import, and press "save" when you\'re ready.
